sentences.sContent: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.sCn: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.sContent: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.sCn: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。
我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.sContent: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.sCn: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

sentences.sContent: ...all that was every exciting with new things coming out...
...Mass adoption of the Internet is driving one of the most exciting social...
...But the most exciting part about Inkling...
...America's ability to invest people and money in exciting new ideas is still greater than that of most other wealthy countries...
...solve problems and acquire fascinating facts about the exciting world in which they live.26 Why do some children trapped in a burning building hide from masked fire fighters...

synos.tran: 令人兴奋的；使人激动的

words.tran: 易激动的；易兴奋的；易怒的
兴奋；刺激；令人兴奋的事物
[生理] 兴奋性，应激性；可激发性
